Vocabulary.Caught: To capture or take hold of something.
Vocabulary.Fisherman: A person who catches fish as a job or hobby.
Vocabulary.Flute: A musical instrument played by blowing across a hole.

Sentences.Text: Once, there was a Fisherman who loved music.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Fisherman will do with his love for music?
FunQuestions: What kind of music do you enjoy?

Sentences.Text: He had a flute and a fishing net.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Fisherman will do with his flute and net?
FunQuestions: Have you seen a flute before?
What do people use fishing nets for?

Sentences.Text: One day, he went to the sea and played his flute, hoping the fish would hear his music.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the Fisherman is using music to catch fish?
FunQuestions: What kind of sounds might attract fish?

Sentences.Text: But the fish did not come and stayed in the water.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the fish didn’t come?
FunQuestions: Do you think music can attract animals?
What other ways can fish be caught?

Sentences.Text: The Fisherman stopped playing, threw his net into the sea, and soon caught many fish.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why did the Fisherman stop playing his flute?
FunQuestions: What does it mean to persevere?
Have you ever tried something new to solve a problem?

Sentences.Text: As the fish jumped in the net, the Fisherman said, 'When I played music, you didn’t come. Now, you jump so happily!'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Fisherman learned from this?
FunQuestions: Why do you think the fish jumped happily now?
What other lessons can we learn from the Fisherman?
